META.project_title: TedTracker: Follow Cruz on the Campaign Trail
META.project_intro: On March 23, 2015, U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz became the first major candidate to announce he was running for president in 2016. Since then, he has been crisscrossing the country at a feverish pace, looking to make the most of his head start on the rest of his potential rivals. Below we’ve compiled the public events — past and future — Cruz has announced since making his run official.
META.project_intro_clean: On March 23, 2015, U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz became the first major candidate to announce he was running for president in 2016. Since then, he has been crisscrossing the country at a feverish pace, looking to make the most of his head start on the rest of his potential rivals. We've compiled the public events — past and future — Cruz has announced since making his run official.

FUTURE.description: Cruz is one of several presidential contenders scheduled to speak at the NRA's annual meeting.
Cruz is one of several presidential contenders scheduled to speak at the New Hampshire GOP's First in the Nation Leadership Summit.
Cruz is scheduled to deliver remarks to the Young Republicans Convention of New Hampshire.
Cruz is a confirmed speaker at the Republican Jewish Coalition spring meeting.
Cruz is set to speak at the Iowa Faith & Freedom Coalition's 15th Annual Spring Kick-off Event.
Cruz will do a question and answer session with the U.S. Hispanic Chamber of Commerce.
Cruz is one of several presidential contenders planning to speak at the South Carolina Freedom Summit, sponsored by Citizens United.

PAST.description_md: Cruz announces he’s running for president in 2016.
Cruz attends a rally for the Conservative Business League of New Hampshire.
Cruz attends a dinner at the Young America’s Foundation New England Freedom Conference.
Cruz attends a brunch for the Rockingham County Republican Committee and Seacoast Republican Women.
Cruz takes photos with supporters at his campaign headquarters then holds a rally outside.
Cruz attends a reception for the Republican Party of Dubuque County.
Cruz participates in a town hall organized by the Spartanburg County GOP.
Cruz attends a reception for the Republican Women Dessert.
Cruz meets with the Aiken Republican Club.
